thread.title: White Sox claim OF Garcia; Coats DFA'd
thread.title_full: White Sox claim OF Garcia; Coats DFA'd

title: White Sox claim OF Garcia; Coats DFA'd
text:
White Sox claim OF Garcia; Coats DFA'd Garcia's three-run shot 0:49 3/18/15: Willy Garcia crushes a laser three-run home run, his first of the spring, to left-center field to extend the Pirates' lead to five By Cash Kruth / MLB.com | + 0 COMMENTS 
The White Sox claimed outfielder Willy Garcia off waivers from the Pirates on Friday and designated outfielder Jason Coats for assignment. 
Garcia was designated for assignment by the Pirates on Dec. 31 after spending all season at Triple-A Indianapolis, where the 24-year-old hit .245 with 30 doubles, six home runs and 43 RBIs. 
â€¢ Hot Stove Tracker 
The 6-foot-2, 215-pound Garcia is a career .257 hitter in seven Minor League seasons and has been praised by prospect publications for his throwing arm. 
Coats hit .200 in 28 games with the White Sox, spending the majority of the season at Triple-A Charlotte. The 26-year-old hit .330 with 22 doubles and 10 home runs in 78 Minor League games. 
The White Sox 40-man roster remains full. is a reporter for MLB.com. Follow him on Twitter at @cashkruth . This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs. Share This
